info.abstract:
[Type] General.
[Behaviour] It executes a bash script. The script can eventually use the env var OPH_SCRIPT_SESSION_PATH passed by the operator and pointing to <oph_web_server_location>/sessions/<session_code>/export/misc.
[Parameters] - script : name of the script to be executed (when requested "./" has to be included) - args : list of pipe-separated arguments to be passed to the script - stdout : file where stdout will be redirected (appended) or "stdout" for no redirection - stderr : file where stderr will be redirected (appended) or "stderr" for no redirection
[System parameters] - exec_mode : operator execution mode. Possible values are async (default) for asynchronous mode, sync for synchronous mode with json-compliant output. - ncores : number of parallel processes to be used (min. 1). This operator is not parallel, so the only possible value is 1. - sessionid : session identifier used server-side to manage sessions and jobs. Usually users don't need to use/modify it, except when it is necessary to create a new session or switch to another one. - objkey_filter : filter on the output of the operator written to file (default=all => no filter, none => no output). script : show the full command that was launched.
[Examples] Execute the script "./test.sh var1 var2" without redirecting stdout and stderr: OPH_TERM: oph_script script=./test.sh;args=var1|var2; SUBMISSION STRING: "operator=oph_script;script=./test.sh;args=var1|var2;"
